CatDescriptText: Reverend J.B. Gillespie, 368 Burrows Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "I think the minister does and the reason is because I myself am a minister.  I think that I can exert more influence than any politician and the reason why is because that I have somebody up above helping me."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Reverend J.B. Gillespie, wearing small moustache, plaid necktie, and dark suit jacket, standing on corner of Fifth Avenue and Liberty Avenue, with May Building with Thrift Drugs, Downtown
